description: From Ancient Greek γιγαντικός (gigantikós), ultimately from γίγας (gígas, “giant”).  According to the Poly-Olbion project coined by Michael Drayton in 1612.

adjectives.description: gigantic (comparative more gigantic, superlative most gigantic)

examples: Thou Genius of the place (this most renowned Ile)
Which livedst long before the All-earth-drowning Flood,
Whilst yet the world did swarme with her Gigantick brood;
This band is going to be gigantic.

entries.meaning: In the manner of a giant.
